titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Collection of Bookplates by Mark Severin
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Arts Library Special Collections staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:03

did.unittitle: Collection of Bookplates by Mark Severin
did.abstract: This collection includes bookplates and other graphic works by Mark Severin (1906-1987), a Belgian artist and graphic designer.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Yale Bookplate Collection was formerly housed in Sterling Memorial Library. The collection was incorporated into the Arts of the Book Collection in 1984 and then moved to the Seeley G. Mudd Library in 1990. In 2011, it was transferred to the Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Collection of Bookplates by Mark Severin, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was removed from filing cabinets which housed bookplates by individual artists. Some materials included in this collection indicate the provenance of the following collectors or collections: Irene D. Andrews Pace, Warren Hiram Lowenhaupt, Harry D. Scammell, A. Bernard C. K. Keeves, and Baron Gunnar de Tr√∂nnberg.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mark Fernand Severin (1906-1987) was a Belgian artist and graphic designer, active mostly in England. He designed hundreds of bookplates, including many erotic ex-libris designs, as well as postage stamps, book illustrations, advertising posters, and other graphic works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the following materials: bookplates designed by Mark Severin (1906-1987) for a variety of patrons; bookplates designed for Severin by other artists; other graphic works by Severin, including several Christmas and New Year's greeting cards; and correspondence and ephemera by Severin or otherwise related to the collection, though unattached to specific bookplates.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Bookplates by Severin. II. Bookplates by Other Artists for Severin. III. Other Works by Severin. IV. Correspondence and Ephemera.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by patron name. Any correspondence or ephemeral materials relating to a specific bookplate are filed together with the bookplate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains primarily bookplates for individuals, although a few institutional bookplates are also present. Multiple designs for the same patron are filed together, and most files are accompanied by typed notes, which identify artist's proofs and varying states, provide additional context from Severin's letters, etc.

did.unittitle: Anonymous [title vignette in a book about bookplates]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The folder also includes an original pencil sketch for this bookplate design.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains one armorial bookplate; four bookplates featuring a sailing ship superimposed with a woman's face (varying states); and a letter written by Jacques Beaupain to Warren Hiram Lowenhaupt, dated February 27, 1958.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains a pencil-and-ink drawing for a maritime bookplate design as well as a two prints and a watercolor-and-pencil original sketch for a bookplate design featuring an okapi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains ten small pencil sketches, lettered b through k, and a letter concerning the design written by Severin to Mr. Rowlands, dated March 3, 1963.

did.unittitle: Y. de Brouwer, Duc in Attum

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains a page from Severin's sketchbook that shows seven preliminary designs (six pencil, one watercolor) for the Cooreman bookplate, including an original sketch for the final design.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains variations on an HD monogram design as well as a pictorial bookplate featuring a variety of bird species; Dirkx was an avid bird watcher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains a bookplate designed for the library aboard the yacht, "Girl Stella."

did.unittitle: George Maclean and Margaret Dawson Hellyer
Institute Pour La Recherche Scientifique En Afrique Centrale

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains a super ex-libris design that is a gold stamp on brown leather.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes engraved woodblock for bee-keeping bookplate of Lawrence H. Seccombe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder also contains bookplates designed by Mark Severin for his wife, Nina.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This is a design for a bookseller's label.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains two artist's proofs as well as a pencil drawing of the larger version of this armorial ex-libris design.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder only contains a photographic reproduction of Severin's ex-libris design for Mrs. Wiener.

did.unittitle: Bookplates by Other Artists for Severin

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged according to the accompanying checklist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains bookplates designed for Severin by other artists. It includes works by: B. Bramanti, T. Buckland Wright, Cecil Keeling, A. Decaris, Ernst Gohlert, Anton Vermeyten, Valentin Le Campion, Ruda Gajdos, Italo Zetti, Lucharsky, Frank Martin, and G. Gandaen.

did.unittitle: Bookplates by Other Artists for Severin

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged according to the accompanying checklist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains other graphic work by Severin, including a birth announcement; an MS monogram design; a map of Uccle, Belgium; and several Christmas and New Year's greeting cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains eight letters from Severin to Irene D. Andrews Pace, dating from 1947 to 1959, and six letters from Severin to Warren Hiram Lowenhaupt, dating from 1954 to 1962. In addition, the series also contains exchange cards and various checklists of Severin's work (including lists generated and annotated by Severin himself).
